newsitem.title: INDIA: LATE BUYING LIFTS DELHI SHARES TO HIGHER CLOSE.
newsitem.headline: LATE BUYING LIFTS DELHI SHARES TO HIGHER CLOSE.

text.p: Delhi stock prices closed sharply higher on Monday following strong buying by foreign and domestic financial institutions, brokers said.
The Delhi Stock Exchange's benchmark index closed 10.40 points higher at 945.77. The index was 934.67 in the afternoon trade.
"Inspite of a recovery towards the close of the session, it was difficult to predict the future trends," said Pradeep Malhotra of brokers H.P. Sharma and Associates.
Traders said the start of a fresh fortnightly settlement period on the Bombay Stock Exchange also spurred buying on the Delhi bourse.
Foreign funds bought stocks of automobile companies, banks and multinational stocks, they said.
Reliance Industries traded heavily through the session. It dipped to 371 rupees before recovering 9.85 rupees to close at 381.20.
State Bank of India ended 5.85 rupees higher at 333.45. It had dropped to 327.10 in early trading, brokers said.
ITC Ltd closed 0.20 rupee higher at 578.40.
ACC shot up 49 rupees to close at 1,587.
Escorts Ltd edged up two rupees to 115.
